bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I was get this error today: ValueError: could not convert string to float: 'data/slimyolov3/images/val/0000291_00001_d_0000868.jpg' <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
this is my .data file: classes=10 train=data/slimyolov3/train.list valid=data/slimyolov3/val.list labels=data/slimyolov3/labels.txt names=data/slimyolov3/labels.txt backup=backup eval=coco I see that in datasets.py, if my val is in another extension than '.txt", it will think .shapes file exists. current path: "data/slimyolov3/val.list" sp = path.replace('.txt', '.shapes') # shapefile path sp after replace: "data/slimyolov3/val.list" So, when file is readed, s will have something like that: [['data/slimyolov3/images/val/0000291_00001_d_0000868.jpg'], ['data/slimyolov3/images/val/0000330_01801_d_0000809.jpg'] .... ] so when this line is executed: s = np.array(s, dtype=np.float64) will raise ValueError: could not convert string to float <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I think it is a little confusing, because it is due to wrong file extension in 'valid'. I think should handle the error better. When I change to .txt, it works. Thanks!
